meanings.definition: Lacking in quality or quantity; inferior or paltry.
meanings.sent2: The measlier apples were small and tasteless.
meanings.sent3: He offered a measlier excuse for being late.
meanings.sent4: Her measlier efforts paled in comparison to his hard work.
meanings.sent5: The measlier paint job left streaks and patches.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a small or inadequate amount; stingy or miserly.
meanings.sent1: His measlier tip was barely enough to cover the bill.
meanings.sent2: The measlier portions at the buffet disappointed the guests.
meanings.sent3: She gave a measlier donation than usual to the charity.
meanings.sent4: The measlier businessman refused to share his profits.
meanings.sent5: The measlier savings account barely grew over the years.
